content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table, with 8 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x,” and the heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is 10. f of x is 29. Column 2. x is 10.9. f of x is 31.7. Column 3. x is 10.99. f of x is 31.97. Column 4. x is 10.999. f of x is 31.997. Column 5. x is 11.001. f of x is 32.003. Column 6. x is 11.01. f of x is 32.03. Column 7. x is 11.1. f of x is 32.3. Column 8. x is 12. f of x is 35." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 4em 4em 4em 4em 3em 3em" equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>10</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>10.9</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>10.99</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>10.999</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>11.001</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>11.01</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>11.1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>12</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>29</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>31.7</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>31.97</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>31.997</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>32.003</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>32.03</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>32.3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>35</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The table above gives values of the function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> at selected values of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following conclusions is supported by the data in the table?

choices.label: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 11, of, f of x, equals 32" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>11</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>32</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 11, of, f of x, equals infinity" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>11</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 32, of, f of x, equals 11" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>32</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>11</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 32, of, f of x, equals infinity" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>32</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 11, of, f of x, equals 32" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>11</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>32</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
